title: OSHWA missing in list of `repo hosts`
body: may be a crawler-related issue, since [repoHost property](https://losh.ose-germany.de/wiki/Property:P112) is missing for OSHWA projects, e.g. https://losh.ose-germany.de/wiki/Item:Q15071

title: `go to repo` of version-specific page points to generic repo
body: if project detail pages are version-specific, I'd expect to view the project's repository at that specific version. instead it always points to the latest (stable?) version of the repository

title: Style Organization filter box as other dropdowns

url: Styles the "placeholder" text and the dropdown arrow icon so it does not look greyed out like the filter field was disabled.
Makes the Organization filter field look like other filters.

title: Minor changes to the filter and search form

url: Adds labels to filter fields and makes labels above the fields (also for the search field). Additionally makes the organizations in the filter field sorted alphabetically so it is easier to find the right option when scrolling through the list.
Uses full word "repository" in the new elements, preparing for the wider change from "repo" to "repository".

title: Sort organization names in the filter dropdown alphabetically

url: Sorts the names in the organization filter so it is easier to find the wanted organization when scrolling through the full/partial list.

title: add thumbnails on search page
body: to allow far faster assessment of usefulness of results

url: - repo hosts with most results appear on the top of the filter list (with number)
- repo hosts without results are now shown in the first place

title: choose number of results is not available always
body: sometimes the option is available, sometimes not

title: download results only works for current page
body: …hence the download has to be repeated for _all_ pages

url: → it should be possible to download all results by one click

title: filter for open file formats (source files)
body: the current release of DIN SPEC 3105-1 makes no difference whether source files (especially CAD files) use an open or proprietary file format. However, in practice proprietary file formats require the use of proprietary software, which may be a significant barrier for OSH developers and makers (optional footnote: a basic CATIA license starts at $ 4.5k a year)

url: → would be very helpful if one could filter results for open file formats

title: [Feature] add counter for results
body: would be great to know the total number of results when searching OSH

url: Also, when nothing is entered in the search bar, the counter could just display the total amount of items in the DB

title: Project description in English, German and French
body: For European patents (EP patents), claims have to be written in German, English and French to make a first patent search easier.

url: Personally, I would like to see this at the LOSH-Frontend as well, so that it is easier to find a project. At least the project description as shown on the detail page should be displayed in English, German and French (automatically translated for older projects) under the original description.
